WorkItem.Description:
In a simpple windows with a WPF DataGrid, when you use the setter for button style, like this
 
<Window.Resources>
    <Style TargetType="{x:Type Button}">
        <Setter Property="Margin" Value="4,4,4,4" />
    </Style>
</Window.Resources>
 
Visual Studio freeze. In task manager the percentage of CPU utilization is near 100%.
 
This is the complete XAML code
 
<Window x:Class="ColonneMobili.PersonWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:dg="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Controls;assembly=WPFToolkit"
        Title="Anagrafica" Height="300" Width="544" WindowStartupLocation="CenterScreen" ResizeMode="NoResize"
        FocusManager.FocusedElement="{Binding ElementName=grid}">
    <Window.Resources>
        <Style TargetType="{x:Type Button}">
            <Setter Property="Width" Value="90" />
            <Setter Property="Margin" Value="4,4,4,4" />
        </Style>
    </Window.Resources>
    <Grid>
        <Grid.RowDefinitions>
            <RowDefinition Height="100*" />
            <RowDefinition Height="40" />
        </Grid.RowDefinitions>
        <dg:DataGrid Name="grid" Margin="0" KeyUp="GridKeyUp">
            <dg:DataGrid.Columns>
                <dg:DataGridTextColumn Header="Codice Fiscale" Binding="{Binding PersonId}" Width="100" />
            </dg:DataGrid.Columns>
        </dg:DataGrid>
    </Grid>
</Window>
 
NB: Sorry for my bad english
 
--
Roberto Corradetti
WorkItem.Summary: Use Setter for Button Margin cause Visual Studio freeze

Comments.Message:
This only happens with the Button Style without a key setting Margin when there is a DataGrid present.
Doesn't happen with DatePicker instead of DataGrid.
Doesn't happen when DataGrid has no columns defined.
Works ok with a Style Key set:
<Style x:Key="stdButton" TargetType="{x:Type Button}">
    <Setter Property="Margin" Value="2"/>
</Style>
Occurs when style is set in window resources or in application resources.


Effect is that the grid in the VS2008 SP1 designer keeps expanding forever locking up the IDE.
This also happens in Expression Blend 2.

I hit this issue too with this code:

<Window x:Class="DGBugWindow"
    xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
    xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
    xmlns:tk="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Controls;assembly=WPFToolkit"
    Title="DGBugWindow" Height="300" Width="300">
    <Window.Resources>
        <Style TargetType="{x:Type Button}">
            <Setter Property="Margin" Value="3"/>
        </Style>
    </Window.Resources>
    <Grid>
        <tk:DataGrid>
            <tk:DataGrid.Columns>
                <tk:DataGridTextColumn Header="Test" />
            </tk:DataGrid.Columns>
        </tk:DataGrid>
    </Grid>
</Window>

*WORKAROUND*

    <Style TargetType="{x:Type tk:DataGrid}">
        <Style.Resources>
            <Style TargetType="{x:Type Button}">
                <Setter Property="Margin" Value="0"/>
            </Style>
        </Style.Resources>
    </Style>
